Posts.Content: Hi there! I have my story and photos under the Member Resource Directory if it might help. Just look for my photo. :) You're not alone!!!! Hang in there! xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Bilateral Mastecomy with Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi All, Well, it's been almost a week since my nips were constructed and I'm doing great. Had to recreate the "monopoly hotel" cover (thing protecting the nip on all sides all the way to the top) on my own by sterilizing a sponge and cutting a hole in it but other than that it's all good. Like a lot of you I had a major reaction to the tape and switched it out for paper tape which was 1000 times better! Heavy bruising on the tops of both but the pain is minimal. I change out the gauze and put neosporin on them daily. I have to be careful not to "smush" them or they could collapse so sleeping is a little less delightful lately. I'm told this will be the deal for the next 6-8 weeks. Still a lot less harder than what I've been through already! Love to All! xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Nipple Update

Posts.Content: Hi Slynch, I had my surgery on a Wednesday and went back to work (albeit sore) on that Monday. Really not too bad. xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Exchange surgery & Work

Posts.Content: Why a Samurai you ask? I'm a blonde Welsh/Irish/Scandnavian-well let's call me an Ellis Island gene mutation at this point, white American...hmmm. Well, in everyone's mind, filed securely in your database for emergencies, I believe there is a survival chip. Some do not know how to access it. Some ignore it or don't recognize it and for some like myself it shows up just in the nick time like the sounds of an ice cream truck in the distance on a hot summer day. As my husband Chris and I sat holding hands, white knuckled and took the news that the second biopsy confirmed breast cancer, I didn't cry. I felt red with anger. I envisioned myself as an angry, tough, mean and unstoppable Samurai warrior with a long, shining steel sword ready to kick cancer's ***. (my survival chip must have been 'Made in Japan') xxoo, JoJo

Posts.Title: What's in your name?

Posts.Content: Hi VS!!! I am so thrilled you are doing well and made it through!!!! Congratulations! Almost there. xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Vicki Sam is home, resting and recovering -- Not too bad // Exchange went well this morning at 7:30, home by 1 p.m.

Posts.Content: Hi All, It's been a while. I've been on the job market online at night so as you can imagine that sucks the life right out of ya after a long day's work at my existing hell hole. ;) (any yes I'm glad to have any hell hole paying me at the moment but I've got to find a new hell hole! ;) This could take years in this wonderful economy!) OK enough boo hoo job stuff. Hmm. How do I describe this...Righty is all healed but I'm feeling like she's a tad too "tall" and not shirinking enough. She's the size of an eraser if you pulled it out of a new pencil. Hmmm. Hoping she'll shrink to more of a "mid-semester" already whittled down eraser size. Lefty, well Lefty is just the right size but still not healing. Every day I change the gauze there's still a little crusty stuff that comes off. (sorry to be gross) They were done in June (I think) and I've never had anything take THIS long to heal. Implants were put in March and I still have pain when I overdo it. i.e. carrying in heavy groceries, etc. My tatooing is set for September 11th. I'm hoping my ps's confidence is right so that by then they'll look exactly as they should. Ah the impatience of what we endure!!! Love you all!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! xxoo, SamuraiMom p.s.On a positive, exciting note... I made it to the voting portion of the Pepsi Refresh Project online to maybe win a grant for my website!! I need to be in the top ten by August 31st to win the grant!vote for me if you like at: www.refresheverything.com/mymastectomyonline If we can't find the cure just yet we CAN help keep getting the word out!
Posts.Title: Update on Lefty and Righty the Nipsters

Posts.Content: Hi Invisi-Sistas! OK so I did a whole lot of worrying for nothing. Still on for nipple reconstruction this Saturday. Starting to overeat in an effort to cope. What's new? Anyway, I kept seeing this strange large "thing" that resembled a large vein moving aroud the top of my boob. I thought I'd better tell the plastic surgeon before he cut. Turns out it was just the "rippling" of the silicone implant. I'd never noticed anything like this until recently. I think it may be because my pectoral muscles are finally starting loosen up and you can see more of the implant. Just wanted to share in this new development. Maybe I'll only gain five pounds this week! ;) xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Funky vein looking thing...

Posts.Content: I decided on a double when I was diagnosed on my right side. Visit my blog for the story. ;) They started doing the blood pressure in my arm about 4 months after the surgery when I still had in the expanders. Good luck...you did a brave and smart thing!
Posts.Title: ? on bilaterial mastectomy

Posts.Content: I love you guys and want to know how to add to my friend list! This Techno-Tard needs a lesson. And btw what does "bump a thread" mean? xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: How do you make someone your "friend" in CSN?

Posts.Content: My plastic surgeon is performing a procedure on me next Saturday where he basically purse strings the skin up to form the nipple and then tattos in the color once it's healed. Anyone else out there do nipple reconstruction without the skin graft? Skin graft folks are you happy with them? Thanks for your help! SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Nipple Reconstruction Poll

Posts.Content: All I have to say is...BAD MACHINE!!! BAD MACHINE!! Hang in there!!! xxoo, SamuraiMom
Posts.Title: Broken Mammo Machine!

Posts.Content: Congrats! I felt human again once those things came out!! XXOO, SamuraiMom
